</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.5
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>dex105.htm
<DESCRIPTION>THE COMPANY'S DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN, AMENDED AND RESTSTATED OCT 1, 2007
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>The Company's Deferred Compensation Plan, Amended and Reststated Oct 1, 2007</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.5 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Hershey Company </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Deferred Compensation Plan </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Amended and Restated as of October&nbsp;1, 2007 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Deferred Compensation Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) allows participants in the following programs of The Hershey Company Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (the &#147;EICP&#148;) to defer receipt of all or part
of the following awards: (1)&nbsp;cash awards under the Annual Incentive Program (the &#147;AIP&#148;), (2)&nbsp;the cash equivalent or Common Stock of The Hershey Company (the &#147;Company&#148;) representing performance stock unit
(&#147;PSU&#148;) awards under the EICP, and (3)&nbsp;awards of Common Stock of the Company pursuant to restricted stock unit (&#147;RSU&#148;) awards under the EICP granted on or after January&nbsp;1, 2001. This Plan also allows participants in The
Hershey Company Amended and Restated (2007)&nbsp;Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (the &#147;DB SERP&#148;) and The Hershey Company Compensation Limit Replacement Plan (the &#147;CLRP&#148;) to defer receipt of all or a portion of a lump sum
cash payment payable under the DB SERP and CLRP. In addition, the Company may allocate Supplemental Core Retirement and Supplemental Match Contributions on behalf of eligible Plan Participants, and the Company may credit a specified percentage of
Compensation for the benefit of certain Plan Participants under the Defined Contribution Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (the &#147;DC SERP&#148;). The Plan is intended to benefit those executives of the Company and subsidiaries who are
specified as participants in and receive awards under the EICP, former participants of the DB SERP and CLRP, and Plan Participants with compensation in excess of Code section 401(a)(17), to secure their goodwill, loyalty and achievement, and to help
attract and retain highly qualified executives. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For Grandfathered Amounts (as defined below), the terms of the Plan in effect on
December&nbsp;31, 2004 and the requirements summarized in Appendix A of this Plan shall be followed in all respects. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Article&nbsp;I </B>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Definitions </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
following definitions apply to this Plan: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.1 <U>401(k) Plan</U>. &#147;401(k) Plan&#148; means The Hershey Company 401(k) Plan, formerly
the Hershey Foods Corporation Employee Savings Stock Investment and Ownership Plan, as in effect from time to time and any successor plan thereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">1.2 <U>Account</U>. &#147;Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each Participant under the Plan, which includes, but is not limited to, the following Sub-Accounts: (i)&nbsp;a Supplemental Core Retirement
Contributions Sub-Account, (ii)&nbsp;a Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account, (iii)&nbsp;an AIP Sub-Account, (iv)&nbsp;a PSU Sub-Account, (v)&nbsp;an RSU Sub-Account, (vi)&nbsp;a DB SERP Sub-Account, (vii)&nbsp;a CLRP Sub-Account, and
(viii)&nbsp;a DC SERP Sub-Account. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.3 <U>AIP and AIP Awards</U>. &#147;AIP&#148; means the Annual Incentive Program, and any successor or
replacement program thereof, of the EICP, including annual incentives awarded under the Company&#146;s Sales Incentive Program and any successor or replacement thereof, and &#147;AIP Awards&#148; means cash awards made to a Participant under the AIP
of the EICP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.4 <U>AIP Sub-Account</U>. &#147;AIP Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each
Participant electing to defer under this Plan all or a portion of his or her AIP Awards. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.5 <U>Board or Board of Directors</U>.
&#147;Board&#148; or &#147;Board of Directors&#148; means the Board of Directors of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.6 <U>Change in Control</U>.
&#147;Change in Control&#148; means a Change in Control as such term is defined in the EICP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.7 <U>Change in Control Event</U>.
&#147;Change in Control Event&#148; means a Change in Control Event as defined under Code section 409A and applicable guidance thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">1.8 <U>Code</U>. &#147;Code&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.9 <U>Committee or Compensation
Committee</U>. &#147;Committee&#148; or &#147;Compensation Committee&#148; means the Compensation and Executive Organization Committee of the Board or any successor committee having similar authority. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.10 <U>Company</U>. &#147;Company&#148; means The Hershey Company, a Delaware corporation. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.11 <U>Company Common Stock or Common Stock</U>. &#147;Company Common Stock&#148; or &#147;Common Stock&#148; means the publicly traded common stock of
the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.12 <U>Compensation</U>. &#147;Compensation&#148; means the sum of (i)&nbsp;base salary paid to a Participant during a
calendar year and (ii)&nbsp;AIP Awards for that calendar year, whether paid or deferred. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.13 <U>CLRP and CLRP Benefits</U>.
&#147;CLRP&#148; means The Hershey Company Amended and Restated Compensation Limit Replacement Plan, and any successor or replacement plan thereof, and &#147;CLRP Benefits&#148; means amounts payable to a Participant under the CLRP that are deferred
under this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.14 <U>CLRP Sub-Account</U>. &#147;CLRP Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for
each Participant electing to defer under this Plan all or a portion of his or her lump sum cash payment payable under the CLRP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.15
<U>Core Retirement Contributions</U>. &#147;Core Retirement Contributions&#148; means contributions made by the Company on behalf of an employee who is eligible to receive such contributions under the 401(k) Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.16 <U>DB SERP and DB SERP Benefits</U>. &#147;DB SERP&#148; means The Hershey Company Amended and Restated (2007)&nbsp;Supplemental Executive
Retirement Plan and any successor or replacement plan thereof, and &#147;DB SERP Benefits&#148; means amounts payable to a Participant under the DB SERP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.17 <U>DB SERP Sub-Account</U>. &#147;DB SERP Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established
by the Company for each Participant electing to defer under this Plan all or a portion of his or her lump sum cash payment payable under the DB SERP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.18 <U>DC SERP and DC SERP Benefits</U>. &#147;DC SERP&#148; means the Defined Contribution Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan as described under Article VI, or any successor or replacement plan thereof, and
&#147;DC SERP Benefits&#148; means amounts credited to a Participant&#146;s DC SERP Sub-Account in accordance with Article VI. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.19 <U>DC
SERP Sub-Account</U>. &#147;DC SERP Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each Participant to which amounts are credited on behalf of the Participant under the DC SERP. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.20 <U>Determination Date</U>. &#147;Determination Date&#148; means the last day of each calendar quarter or any other date specified by the Plan
Administrator in its sole discretion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.21 <U>Disabled or Disability</U>. &#147;Disabled&#148; or &#147;Disability&#148; means Disabled as
that term is defined in The Hershey Company Retirement Plan, as in effect from time to time and any successor plan thereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.22
<U>EBPP</U>. &#147;EBPP&#148; means, with respect to a Participant, The Hershey Company Employee Benefits Protection Plan (Group 2), The Hershey Company Executive Benefits Protection Plan (Group 3), The Hershey Company Executive Benefits Protection
Plan (Group 3A), or The Hershey Company Severance Benefits Plan, as applicable to such Participant, and any successor or replacement plans thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">1.23 <U>EICP</U>. &#147;EICP&#148; means The Hershey Company Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (formerly known as the Hershey Foods Corporation Key Employee Incentive Plan) and any successor or replacement plan thereof. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.24 <U>Grandfathered Amounts</U>. &#147;Grandfathered Amounts&#148; means amounts that were deferred under this Plan, if any, by a Participant who was
neither an active employee of the Company nor on a paid or Disabled leave of absence on October&nbsp;1, 2007, to which such Participant had a nonforfeitable right as of December&nbsp;31, 2004, plus subsequent investment credits. Grandfathered
Amounts are only subject to the terms of the Plan in effect on December&nbsp;31, 2004 and the requirements set forth in Appendix A of this Plan. Grandfathered Amounts are exempt from the requirements under Code section 409A. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.25 <U>Initial Deferral Election</U>. &#147;Initial Deferral Election&#148; means an election to defer (i)&nbsp;AIP Awards, (ii)&nbsp;PSU Awards,
(iii)&nbsp;RSU Awards, (iv)&nbsp;DB SERP Benefits, and/or (v)&nbsp;CLRP Benefits, in accordance with the requirements set forth under Section&nbsp;4.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.26 <U>Investment Options</U>. &#147;Investment Options&#148; means those investment options which are to be used as earnings indices as described in Section&nbsp;2.1. Except as hereafter provided with respect to a
Participant&#146;s constructive investment in Company Common Stock: </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) the Investment Options are chosen by the Plan Administrator and are subject to change from time to time as the Plan Administrator, in its sole
discretion, deems necessary or appropriate, and (b)&nbsp;no provision of this Plan shall be construed as either giving any Participant an interest in any of these Investment Options or requiring that the Company make any investment in any such
Investment Options. Investment Options, other than the Company Common Stock Investment Option, may be added, modified or deleted from time to time in the discretion of the Plan Administrator; provided, however, that after the occurrence of a Change
in Control, the Plan Administrator shall not add or delete any Investment Option that was in effect immediately prior to the Change in Control unless the overall mix of Investment Options is substantially the same as that provided to participants in
the 401(k) Plan or other tax-qualified retirement plan of the Company (whichever has the most investment options available for selection by its participants). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.27 <U>Long Term Disability Plan</U>. &#147;Long Term Disability Plan&#148; means The Hershey Company Long Term Disability Plan and any successor or replacement plan thereof. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.28 <U>Participant</U>. &#147;Participant&#148; means an employee of the Company who meets the eligibility criteria for participation in this Plan
established by the Plan Administrator from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.29 <U>Plan</U>. &#147;Plan&#148; means The Hershey Company Deferred
Compensation Plan as set forth herein and as amended from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.30 <U>Plan Administrator</U>. &#147;Plan Administrator&#148;
means the Employee Benefits Committee of the Company, or any successor committee having similar authority, or such other individual or committee as may be determined by the Compensation Committee from time to time. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.31 <U>Plan Year</U>. &#147;Plan Year&#148; means the calendar year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.32 <U>PSU and PSU Awards</U>. &#147;PSU&#148; means performance stock units granted under the EICP, and &#147;PSU Awards&#148; means PSU awards made to a Participant under the EICP. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.33 <U>PSU Sub-Account</U>. &#147;PSU Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each Participant electing to defer
under this Plan all or a portion of his or her PSU Awards. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.34 <U>Retirement Plan</U>. &#147;Retirement Plan&#148; means The Hershey
Company Retirement Plan, as in effect from time to time and any successor plan thereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.35 <U>RSU and RSU Awards</U>. &#147;RSU&#148;
means restricted stock units granted under the EICP, and &#147;RSU Awards&#148; means RSU awards made to a Participant under the EICP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">1.36 <U>RSU Sub-Account</U>. &#147;RSU Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each Participant electing to defer under this Plan all or a portion of his or her RSU Awards. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.37 <U>Separation from Service</U>. &#147;Separation from Service&#148; or &#147;Separates from Service&#148; means a &#147;separation from
service&#148; within the meaning of Code section 409A; provided that, in </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the event a Participant becomes Disabled and takes a leave of absence from active employment in connection therewith, a Separation from Service shall not
occur for up to 29 months following the first day of such leave of absence, as permitted under Code section 409A and the regulations issued thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.38 <U>Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions</U>. &#147;Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions&#148; means amounts credited to a Participant&#146;s Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account in
accordance with Section&nbsp;3.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.39 <U>Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account</U>. &#147;Supplemental Core Retirement
Contributions Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each Participant to which Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions are credited on behalf of the Participant. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.40 <U>Supplemental Match Contributions</U>. &#147;Supplemental Match Contributions&#148; means amounts credited to a Participant&#146;s Supplemental
Match Contributions Sub-Account in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.41 <U>Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account</U>.
&#147;Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account&#148; means a bookkeeping account established by the Company for each Participant to which Supplemental Match Contributions are credited on behalf of the Participant. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.42 <U>Trust</U>. &#147;Trust&#148; means the trust described in Section&nbsp;9.2. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.43 <U>Year of Service</U>. &#147;Year of Service&#148; means years of Vesting Service as that term is defined in the 401(k) Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Article&nbsp;II </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Account and
Sub-Accounts </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.1 <U>Establishment of Account and Sub-Accounts</U>. Except as provided in Section&nbsp;9.2, any amounts deferred by a
Participant will not be funded or set aside for future payment by the Company. Instead, an Account with Sub-Accounts will be established to which (i)&nbsp;Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions and (ii)&nbsp;Supplemental Match Contributions,
along with deferrals of (iii)&nbsp;AIP Awards, (iv)&nbsp;PSU Awards, (v)&nbsp;RSU Awards, (vi)&nbsp;DB SERP Benefits, (vii)&nbsp;CLRP Benefits, and (viii)&nbsp;DC SERP Benefits, shall be credited to each respective Sub-Account, along with investment
credits as provided in Section&nbsp;2.3.c. below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.2 <U>Participants as Unsecured Creditors</U>. A Participant&#146;s entitlement to
receive the amount reflected by his or her Sub-Accounts, to the extent vested, will be based solely on an unfunded unsecured unconditional promise to pay by the Company that is not assignable. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.3 <U>Investment Credits to Sub-Accounts.</U> Subject to such limitations as may from time to time be required by law, imposed by the Plan
Administrator, or set forth in Section&nbsp;2.3.f. below, and subject to such operating rules and procedures as may be imposed from time to time by the Plan Administrator, each Participant may express to the Plan Administrator a preference as to how
the Participant&#146;s Account should be constructively invested among the Investment Options (&#147;Investment Preference&#148;), in which the Participant shall designate the percentage of his or her Account to be constructively invested in each
Investment Option. Following a Change in Control only, any Participant Investment Preference (whether expressed prior to, or following, a Change in Control) shall be binding upon the Plan Administrator. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. All Investment Preferences shall be in writing on a form supplied by and filed with the Plan
Administrator or in any other form as determined by the Plan Administrator from time to time in its sole discretion. Participants may change their Investment Preferences effective as of the beginning of each Plan Year, or more frequently if
permitted in the discretion of the Plan Administrator; provided, however, that following a Change in Control, Participants shall be permitted to change their Investment Preferences at least as frequently as they could under procedures in effect
immediately prior to the Change in Control. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. Except as set forth above following a Change in Control, all Investment Preferences shall be
advisory only and shall not bind the Company or the Plan Administrator. Neither the Company nor Plan Administrator shall be obligated to invest any funds in connection with this Plan. Moreover, should the Company voluntarily choose to invest any
amount under this Plan, the Plan Administrator shall have complete discretion as to investments, and no Participant shall have any claim on such investments as a fund to provide benefits hereunder. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c. From time to time, but not less frequently than each Determination Date, the Plan Administrator shall allocate the net earnings or losses of the Plan
that have occurred since the preceding Determination Date among the Accounts of Participants, and to the extent a Participant&#146;s Investment Preference is honored by the Plan Administrator, such net earnings or losses shall be allocated as though
the Participant&#146;s Account had been invested in the Investment Options in accordance with the Participant&#146;s Investment Preference. The &#147;net earnings or losses&#148; of the Plan shall be equal to the net increase or net decrease (taking
into account any constructive dividends or interest thereon), as the case may be, in the value of a Participant&#146;s Account since the last Determination Date, based on either the Participant&#146;s Investment Preference (if honored) or the funds
constructively invested by the Plan Administrator and allocated to the Accounts of Participants hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">d. If the Plan Administrator
receives an Investment Preference from a Participant that it deems to be incomplete, unclear or improper, such Participant&#146;s pre-existing Investment Preference then in effect (if any) shall remain in effect until the beginning of the next Plan
Year, unless the Plan Administrator provides for, and permits the application of, corrective action prior thereto. If a Participant fails to file an effective Investment Preference and no pre-existing Investment Preference is on file, the
Participant&#146;s Account will be constructively invested in the Investment Option designated by the Plan Administrator from time to time as a default Investment Option. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">e. If the Plan Administrator determines that the constructive value of an Account as of any date on which distributions are to be made differs materially from the constructive value of the Account on the prior
Determination Date upon which the distribution is to be based, the Plan Administrator, in its discretion, shall have the right to designate any date in the interim as a Determination Date for the purpose of constructively revaluing the Account so
that the Account from which the distribution is being made will, prior to the distribution, reflect its share of such material difference in value. Similarly, the Plan Administrator may adopt a policy of providing for regular interim valuations
without regard to the materiality of changes in the value of the Accounts. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">f. Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Section&nbsp;2.3 to the contrary, (i)&nbsp;prior to a
Change in Control, that portion of all deferred PSUs that is payable in Company Common Stock under the EICP and all deferred RSUs shall be constructively invested in Company Common Stock, (ii)&nbsp;a Participant&#146;s Account shall be credited from
time to time with the amount of any dividends declared and paid on such Company Common Stock, and shall be adjusted in connection with any stock dividend, split, reorganization, liquidation or other event which affects the number of shares of Common
Stock represented by such PSUs and/or RSUs, and (iii)&nbsp;no other amounts deferred under this Plan shall be constructively invested in Company Common Stock. Following a Change in Control, no amounts deferred under this Plan shall be required to be
constructively invested in Company Common Stock. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.4 <U>Statement of Account and Sub-Accounts</U>. Within a reasonable time after the end
of each Plan Year, the Plan Administrator shall submit to each Participant a statement of the balance in his or her Account, including his or her Sub-Accounts; provided, however, that following a Change in Control, such statement of Account and
Sub-Accounts shall be provided on at least a quarterly basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Article III </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Supplemental Core Retirement and Supplemental Match Contributions </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.1
<U>Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. Each Plan Year, for a Participant who (i)&nbsp;is eligible to receive Core Retirement
Contributions under Section&nbsp;5.2(g) of the 401(k) Plan and (ii)&nbsp;defers to this Plan AIP Awards for that Plan Year, the Company shall credit to such Participant&#146;s Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account an amount equal to
three percent (3%)&nbsp;of those deferred AIP Award amounts as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">b. In addition to any amounts credited pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.1.a., each Plan Year, for a Participant who is eligible to receive Core Retirement Contributions under Section&nbsp;5.2(g) of the 401(k) Plan, the Company shall credit to
such Participant&#146;s Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account an amount equal to three percent (3%)&nbsp;of the excess of (1)&nbsp;plus (2)&nbsp;less (3), where (1), (2), and (3)&nbsp;are determined as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) Compensation for that Plan Year as defined under Section&nbsp;1.14 of the 401(k) Plan, other than AIP Awards and without application
of the limitation under Code section 401(a)(17) (indexed for inflation); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) Amounts awarded under the AIP for that Plan
Year that are not deferred under this Plan; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) The limit under Code section 401(a)(17) (indexed for inflation).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c. The amounts described in Sections 3.1.a. and 3.1.b. above shall be credited to a Participant&#146;s
Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year, provided that the Participant either (x)&nbsp;was employed on the last day of the Plan Year or (y)&nbsp;during
the year he or she (1)&nbsp;terminated employment while at least age 55, (2)&nbsp;retired in accordance with the provisions of any applicable Company-sponsored qualified or nonqualified retirement plan or program, (3)&nbsp;became Disabled, or
(4)&nbsp;died. In the case of any allocation for a Plan Year for which the Participant was not employed on December&nbsp;31, except as provided in Section&nbsp;3.1.d., the amount determined under Section&nbsp;3.1.b.(1) shall be based on the
Participant&#146;s actual Compensation paid for services performed through the Participant&#146;s last active day worked for the Company during the year, and which shall not include any amounts paid on account of the Participant&#146;s severance
from employment with the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">d. If a Participant becomes Disabled, such Participant shall continue to be credited with Supplemental
Core Retirement Contributions, in accordance with Sections 3.1.a. and 3.1.b. until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;two (2)&nbsp;years from the date benefits commence under the Company&#146;s Long Term Disability Plan or (ii)&nbsp;the date he or she is no
longer eligible for benefits under the Long Term Disability Plan, based on the amount of annual Compensation (as defined in Section&nbsp;3.1.b.(1) above) that was payable to the Participant at the time he or she becomes Disabled. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.2 <U>Supplemental Match Contributions</U>. Each Plan Year, for a Participant who defers remuneration under the 401(k) Plan equal to (i)&nbsp;the
maximum deferral percentage as permitted by the plan administrator of the 401(k) Plan or (ii)&nbsp;the maximum contribution limit under Code section 402(g) (indexed for inflation) (provided, however, the Plan Administrator may waive the conditions
in (i)&nbsp;or (ii)&nbsp;in their entirety if it determines, in its sole discretion, that the Participant did not satisfy those conditions due to administrative, regulatory or other circumstances beyond the Participant&#146;s reasonable control),
the Company shall credit to such Participant&#146;s Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account an amount, if any, determined under a., b., and c. below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. Four and one-half percent (4-1/2%) of those amounts awarded under the AIP that are deferred under this Plan for that Plan Year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. In addition to any amounts credited pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.2.a., four and one-half percent (4-1/2%) of (1)&nbsp;plus (2)&nbsp;less (3), where (1), (2), and (3)&nbsp;are determined as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) Compensation as defined under Section&nbsp;1.14 of the 401(k) Plan, other than AIP Awards and without application of the limitation
under Code section 401(a)(17) (indexed for inflation), for that Plan Year; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) Amounts awarded under the AIP for that Plan
Year that are not deferred under this Plan; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) The limit under Code section 401(a)(17) (indexed for inflation).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c. The amounts described in Sections 3.2.a. and 3.2.b. above shall be credited to a Participant&#146;s
Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year, provided that the Participant either (x)&nbsp;was employed on the last day of the Plan Year or (y)&nbsp;during the year he
or she (1)&nbsp;terminated employment while at least age 55, (2)&nbsp;retired in accordance with the provisions of any applicable Company-sponsored qualified or nonqualified retirement plan or program, (3)&nbsp;became Disabled, or (4)&nbsp;died. In
the case of any allocation for a Plan Year for which the Participant was not employed on December&nbsp;31, except as provided in the case of a Participant who becomes Disabled, the amount determined under Section&nbsp;3.2.b.(1) shall be based on the
Participant&#146;s actual Compensation paid for services performed through the Participant&#146;s last active day worked for the Company during the year, and which shall not include any amounts paid on account of the Participant&#146;s severance
from employment with the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.3 <U>Time and Form of Distribution</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. <U>Nonelective Initial Deferral</U>. Amounts held in a Participant&#146;s Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account and Supplemental Match
Contributions Sub-Account shall be payable in a lump sum cash payment within ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the earlier of a Separation from Service, subject to the requirements under Section&nbsp;5.2.b., or death, subject to the requirements under
Section&nbsp;5.2.c. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. <U>Change in Time and Form of Distribution</U>. A Participant may make an election to change the time or form of
distribution from that specified in Section&nbsp;3.3.a. pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.2.b. (i.e., a Participant may elect to change the form of payment to any form described in Section&nbsp;5.1.a.), but only if the requirements of Section&nbsp;4.2.a.
are satisfied. A distribution of a Participant&#146;s Supplemental Core Retirement Contributions Sub-Account and/or Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account subject to an election to change under this Section&nbsp;3.3.b. shall be made following
the occurrence of the distributable event designated by the Participant in such election to change. Notwithstanding an election to change under this Section&nbsp;3.3.b., in the case of death, a distribution will be made in accordance with
Section&nbsp;5.2.c. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.4 <U>Vesting</U>. A Participant shall become one hundred percent (100%)&nbsp;vested in his or her Supplemental Core
Retirement Contributions Sub-Account and Supplemental Match Contributions Sub-Account on the date following the completion of three (3)&nbsp;Years of Service with the Company (or, if earlier, the date of any death or Disability of the Participant).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Article IV </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Elections
to Defer </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.1 <U>Initial Deferral Election</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. <U>AIP Awards</U>. A Participant may elect under the Plan to defer receipt of all or a portion of his or her anticipated AIP Award, but such election must be made no later than June&nbsp;30 of the calendar year on
which such award is based. Deferred AIP Awards shall be credited to a Participant&#146;s AIP Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year. If a Participant receives a hardship withdrawal under the
401(k) Plan or a withdrawal upon an Unforeseeable Emergency under Section&nbsp;5.2.d., the Participant&#146;s Initial Deferral Election, if any, for his or her anticipated AIP Award for the Plan Year in which the withdrawal occurs shall be
cancelled. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. <U>PSU Awards</U>. A Participant may elect under the Plan to defer receipt of all or a portion of the
cash or Company Common Stock amount earned as a PSU Award by a date specified by the Plan Administrator in its sole discretion, but such election must be made no later than June&nbsp;30 of the calendar year in which the performance period for such
PSU Award ends. Deferred PSU Awards shall be credited to a Participant&#146;s PSU Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c. <U>RSU Awards</U>. A Participant may elect under the Plan to defer receipt of all or a portion of the Company Common Stock amount earned as an RSU
Award, but such election must be made no later than thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the date of grant and at least 12 months in advance of the first vesting date with respect to such grant. Deferred RSU Awards shall be credited to a Participant&#146;s
RSU Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year. Upon the occurrence of both a Change in Control and Change in Control Event, all restrictions on a Participant&#146;s RSU Awards shall lapse pursuant to
the terms of the EICP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">d. <U>DB SERP Benefits</U>. A Participant may elect to defer all or a portion of the lump sum cash payment payable
under the DB SERP, provided the election is made at least twelve (12)&nbsp;months before such amounts are payable under the DB SERP. A distribution of DB SERP Benefits under this Plan may not be made earlier than five (5)&nbsp;years from the date
the distribution would have been made under the DB SERP but for the Participant&#146;s election to defer such amounts under this Plan. Deferred DB SERP Benefits shall be credited to a Participant&#146;s DB SERP Sub-Account as soon as
administratively practicable following the date a distribution of them under the DB SERP would have otherwise been made. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">e. <U>CLRP
Benefits</U>. A Participant may elect to defer all or a portion of the lump sum cash payment payable under the CLRP, provided the election is made at least twelve (12)&nbsp;months before such amounts are payable under the CLRP. A distribution of
CLRP Benefits under this Plan may not be made earlier than five (5)&nbsp;years from the date the distribution would have been made under the CLRP but for the Participant&#146;s election to defer such amounts under this Plan. Such CLRP Benefits shall
be credited to a Participant&#146;s CLRP Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the date a distribution under the CLRP would have otherwise been made. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">f. Any Initial Deferral Election under this Section&nbsp;4.1: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) Must specify: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(i) The time of distribution under one of the distributable events set forth under Sections 5.2.a. and 5.2.b.; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(ii) The form of distribution as set forth under Section&nbsp;5.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) Shall be irrevocable, except as otherwise
provided in this Plan; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) Shall be made in accordance with procedures and distribution rules established by the
Plan Administrator. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.2 <U>Changes in Time and Form of Distribution</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. A Participant may make a subsequent election to change the time or form of distribution otherwise specified in Section&nbsp;3.3.a., in his or her
Initial Deferral Election pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1., and/or as specified in Section&nbsp;6.3.a. (hereinafter, a &#147;Subsequent Deferral Election&#148;), in accordance with procedures and distribution rules established by the Plan Administrator
and only if the following conditions are satisfied: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) The election may not take effect until at least twelve
(12)&nbsp;months after the date on which the election is made; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) In the case of an election to change the time and form
of a distribution under Sections 5.2.a., 5.2.b. (which includes an election to change the distribution that would occur upon a Separation from Service under Sections 3.3.a. and 6.3.a.), and 5.2.e., a distribution may not be made earlier than five
(5)&nbsp;years from the date the distribution would have otherwise been made; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) The election must be made at least
twelve (12)&nbsp;months before the date of the first scheduled distribution. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. A Participant may make a Subsequent Deferral Election under
Section&nbsp;3.3.b., 4.2.a., or 6.3.b. that indicates a change to a (i)&nbsp;form of distribution set forth in Section&nbsp;5.1.a. and/or (ii)&nbsp;distributable event described in Sections 5.2.a. and 5.2.b.; provided, however, a Separation from
Service distribution event may only be changed to a distribution five (5)&nbsp;or more years following Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.3
<U>Special Election During Transition Years</U>. Notwithstanding the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.2, during 2007 or 2008, a Participant who is an active employee of the Company (including on a paid leave of absence) on or after October&nbsp;1, 2007
may make an election to receive all or a specified portion of his or her Account commencing upon a distributable event described in Sections 5.2.a. and 5.2.b. (including one (1)&nbsp;or more years after Separation from Service) in a lump sum or
substantially equal installment payments over a number of years (to be specified by the Participant) up to fifteen (15)&nbsp;years. Any such election must become irrevocable on or before December&nbsp;31, 2008 and must be made in accordance with
procedures and distribution rules established by the Plan Administrator. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Article V </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Distribution of Deferrals </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
provisions of this Article V shall apply only to amounts subject to Code section 409A. Distribution rules applicable to Grandfathered Amounts are summarized in Appendix A of this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.1 <U>Forms of Distribution</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. A Participant may elect to receive his or her (i)&nbsp;AIP Awards, (ii)&nbsp;PSU Awards, (iii)&nbsp;RSU Awards, (iv)&nbsp;DB SERP Benefits, and/or
(v)&nbsp;CLRP Benefits, which he or she has deferred under this Plan, in: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) A lump sum payment; or </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) Substantially equal annual installment payments over a number of years (to be specified by the Participant) up to fifteen
(15)&nbsp;years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All amounts of a Participant&#146;s Account constructively invested in Company Common Stock shall be distributed in the
form of Company Common Stock, except in the event a Change in Control occurs, in which case amounts constructively invested in Company Common Stock shall be dealt with in accordance with the terms of the EBPP applicable to such Participant. All
other amounts shall be distributed in cash. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. Distributions shall be made or commence (in the case of installment payments)
(1)&nbsp;within ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the occurrence of a distributable event set forth under Section&nbsp;5.2.b.; or (2)&nbsp;within the period following the date selected by the Participant, if any, under Section&nbsp;5.2.a., to the
extent permitted in Treas. Reg. &#167;&nbsp;1.409A-3(d). In the event a Participant has elected to receive annual installment payments, payments after the initial installment shall be made as soon as administratively practicable during the first
calendar quarter of each calendar year after the year in which the prior installment payment was made. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c. Notwithstanding the form of
distribution elected under Section&nbsp;5.1.a., if a Participant&#146;s Account balance is less than the applicable dollar amount under Code section 402(g)(1)(B) at the time the Participant Separates from Service, the full Account balance shall be
distributed in a lump sum payment within ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.2
<U>Permissible Distributable Events</U>. A Participant may designate in his or her Initial Deferral Election under Section&nbsp;4.1 to receive a distribution: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. As of a specified date or time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. Upon a Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) In the case of a Separation from Service of a Key Employee, a distribution may not be made before the date which is six
(6)&nbsp;months after the date of the Key Employee&#146;s Separation from Service (hereinafter called the &#147;Waiting Period&#148;); provided, however, in the event of the Key Employee&#146;s death during the Waiting Period, distribution shall be
made on the date of the Key Employee&#146;s death pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.2.c. Any payments that would otherwise be made during the Waiting Period shall be accumulated and paid in the first month following the Waiting Period, and thereafter, made
in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.1.b. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) During the Waiting Period, a Key Employee&#146;s Account will continue to accrue
investment credits in accordance with Section&nbsp;2.1.c. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) For purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.2.b., Key Employee means
a &#147;specified employee&#148; under Code section 409A(a)(2)(B)(i) (i.e., a key employee (as defined under Code section 416(i) (without regard to paragraph (5)&nbsp;thereof)) of a corporation any stock in which is publicly traded on an established
securities market or otherwise) and applicable Treasury regulations and other guidance under Code section 409A. Key Employees shall be determined in accordance with Code section 409A and pursuant to the methodology established by the Plan
Administrator. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">c. <U>Distribution Upon Death</U>. Notwithstanding any provision in the Plan to the contrary, if a Participant dies, the
unpaid portion of such Participant&#146;s Account balance shall be distributed to the Participant&#146;s beneficiary, or in the absence of a beneficiary, to the Participant&#146;s estate in an immediate lump sum payment as soon as administratively
practicable within ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the date of death. A Participant may designate or change his or her beneficiary (without the consent of any prior beneficiary) on a form provided by the Plan Administrator and delivered to the Plan
Administrator before the Participant&#146;s death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">d. <U>Withdrawals for Unforeseeable Emergency</U>. A Participant may withdraw all or any
portion of his AIP Sub-Account or the cash portion of his or her PSU Sub-Account in the event of demonstrated Unforeseeable Emergency. &#147;Unforeseeable Emergency&#148; means for this purpose a severe financial hardship to a Participant resulting
from an illness or accident of the Participant, the Participant&#146;s spouse, or a dependent (as defined in Code section 152(a)) of the Participant, loss of the Participant&#146;s property due to casualty, or other similar extraordinary and
unforeseeable circumstances arising as a result of events beyond the control of the Participant. The amounts distributed with respect to an Unforeseeable Emergency may not exceed the amounts necessary to satisfy such Unforeseeable Emergency plus
amounts necessary to pay taxes reasonably anticipated as a result of the distribution, after taking into account the extent to which such hardship is or may be relieved through reimbursement or compensation by insurance or otherwise or by
liquidation of the Participant&#146;s assets (to the extent the liquidation of such assets would not itself cause severe financial hardship) or by cessation of deferrals under the Plan. A Participant seeking a withdrawal on account of an
Unforeseeable Emergency must request a hearing with the Plan Administrator. If the Plan Administrator renders a decision in favor of permitting a withdrawal for an Unforeseeable Emergency, such withdrawal amounts shall be payable to the Participant
as soon as administratively practicable within ninety (90)&nbsp;days following such decision. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">e. <U>Distribution Upon a Change in
Control</U>. Notwithstanding any provision in the Plan to the contrary, a Participant&#146;s Account balance under the Plan shall be distributed in an immediate lump sum payment on the later of (i)&nbsp;the first business day of January of the year
following the year in which both a Change in Control and Change in Control Event occurs and (ii)&nbsp;the one hundred twentieth (120th)&nbsp;day following the occurrence of both a Change in Control and Change in Control Event. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.3 <U>Withholding</U>. Any payments made pursuant to Articles III,&nbsp;V, or VI shall be subject to
appropriate federal, state and/or local income tax withholdings. With respect to any withholdings on a distribution of Company Common Stock, the Company will first withhold from the cash equivalent of dividends on such Company Common Stock and
interest earned on such cash equivalent that are payable to the Participant on the date of distribution, and if such withholdings are insufficient, then the Company will withhold from such distribution such number of shares of Company Common Stock
having a fair market value (as defined in the EICP) equal to the amount required to satisfy the remaining tax to be withheld, unless the Participant elects to (i)&nbsp;deposit with the Company such amount of cash or (ii)&nbsp;direct the Company to
withhold cash from other amounts then distributed under this Plan to satisfy such withholding tax. In addition, the Company may reduce a Participant&#146;s Account balance in order to meet any federal, state, or local tax withholdings with respect
to Plan benefits. The Company shall report Plan payments and other Plan-related information to the appropriate governmental agencies as required under applicable laws. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Article VI </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>DC SERP </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.1 <U>Eligibility</U>. An individual will be eligible to become a Participant in this Plan and receive DC SERP Benefits in accordance with this Article
VI if the individual is selected by the Compensation Committee in its sole discretion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.2 <U>Benefits</U>. A Participant meeting the
eligibility requirements under Section&nbsp;6.1 shall receive DC SERP Benefits in an amount equal to a percentage of Compensation determined by the Compensation Committee in its sole discretion. Such DC SERP Benefits shall be credited to a
Participant&#146;s DC SERP Sub-Account as soon as administratively practicable following the last day of the Plan Year, provided that the Participant: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. defers remuneration under the 401(k) Plan equal to either (1)&nbsp;the maximum deferral percentage as permitted by the plan administrator of the 401(k) Plan or (2)&nbsp;the maximum contribution limit under Code
section 402(g) (indexed for inflation) (provided, however, the Plan Administrator may waive the conditions in (i)&nbsp;or (ii)&nbsp;in their entirety if it determines, in its sole discretion, that the Participant did not satisfy those conditions due
to administrative, regulatory or other circumstances beyond the Participant&#146;s reasonable control); and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. either (x)&nbsp;was employed
on the last day of the Plan Year, or (y)&nbsp;during the year he or she (1)&nbsp;terminated employment while at least age 55, (2)&nbsp;retired in accordance with the provisions of any applicable Company-sponsored qualified or nonqualified retirement
plan or program, (3)&nbsp;became Disabled, or (4)&nbsp;died. In the case of any allocation for a Plan Year for which the Participant was not employed on December&nbsp;31, except as provided for in the next paragraph for a Participant who becomes
Disabled, the allocation shall be based on the amount of the Participant&#146;s actual Compensation paid for services performed through the Participant&#146;s last active day worked for the Company during the year and shall not include any amounts
paid on account of the Participant&#146;s severance from employment with the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If a Participant becomes Disabled, such Participant shall continue to be credited with DC SERP Benefits
in accordance with this Section&nbsp;6.2 until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;two (2)&nbsp;years from the date benefits commence under the Long Term Disability Plan or (ii)&nbsp;the date he or she is no longer eligible for benefits under the Long Term
Disability Plan, based on the amount of Compensation that was payable to the Participant at the time he or she became Disabled. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.3
<U>Time and Form of Benefit</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. <U>Nonelective Initial Deferral</U>. Amounts held in a Participant&#146;s DC SERP Sub-Account shall be
payable in a lump sum cash payment within ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the earlier of a Separation from Service, subject to the requirements under Section&nbsp;5.2.b., or death, subject to the requirements under Section&nbsp;5.2.c. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. <U>Change in Time and Form of Distribution</U>. A Participant may make an election to change the time or form of the distribution of his or her DC SERP
Sub-Account as specified in Section&nbsp;6.3.a. in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.2.b. (i.e., a Participant may elect to change the form of payment to any form described in Section&nbsp;5.1.a.), but only if the requirements of Section&nbsp;4.2.a.
are satisfied. A distribution of a Participant&#146;s DC SERP Sub-Account subject to an election to change under this Section&nbsp;6.3.b. shall be made following the occurrence of a distributable event set forth under Sections 5.2.a. and 5.2.b.
Notwithstanding an election to change made under this Section&nbsp;6.3.b., in the case of death, a distribution will be made in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.2.c. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.4 <U>Vesting</U>. Benefits under this Article VI shall be payable only to the extent vested. A Participant shall become vested in his or her DC SERP Sub-Account in accordance with the following vesting schedule,
provided the Participant has first completed five (5)&nbsp;Years of Service with the Company: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
